text:
This is why you didn't see Jennifer Lawrence grace the red carpet.

Fans were disappointed not to see Jennifer Lawrence on any Golden Globe Awards red carpet this year.

Turns out, there's a perfectly good reason why the Oscar winner didn't show up, and it involves fellow actress and BFF Emma Stone.

Explaining all in a Facebook video, J Law reveals that she actually had plans to attend the awards show after-parties, but everything changed when the La La Land star pulled out at the last minute.

"Hi, what happened tonight?" Stone can be heard asking J Law in the video, which E! confirms was filmed by the pair.

"Well, you had told me you wanted me to be your date to the after-parties so I, you know, got us tickets to some after parties, booked a car, and I was halfway through glam when you told me you didn’t wanna go," the Hunger Games star replies.

"You just wanted to come over to my house."

J Law then looks up to face the camera, revealing a single smoky eye and half-face of makeup. "So I sent my hair and makeup team home and now this is what I look like," she explains.

Posted by Jennifer Lawrence on Monday, January 8, 2018

Stone, who attended the ceremony as a Best Actress Nominee, recently revealed in an interview with W magazine how she and Lawrence became mates.

"Jennifer Lawrence and I both had the same stalker, John the Orchestra Guy," the Battle of the Sexes star explained.

"He would text us both and say things like 'I'm running late on my way to the soundstage. Can you warm up the orchestra for me? Text me back and let me know you got this.' He wasn't really a stalker. He must have worked at a studio or something because he had a lot of people's numbers.

"Jen and I texted for a year before we actually met. As she was driving to my house, she thought, Oh, my God, what if it's John the Orchestra Guy? And I thought, Oh, my God, what if it's John the Orchestra Guy?" she added.

"So Jen calls me and says, 'I just want to make sure you're not John the Orchestra Guy.' I wasn't. And we met. It's our adorable love story."

The rest, as they say, is history.
